author: Staff Reporter
text:
An awareness programme for entrepreneurs under way in Thoothukudi on Wednesday.— Photo: N.Rajesh

An awareness programme for SC/ST entrepreneurs to start up new business ventures and explore trade opportunities was conducted here on Wednesday.

The programme was organised by District Industries Centre in association with Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (DICCI) at THUDITSSIA Hall. T. Mayathevar, General Manager, DIC, Thoothukudi, welcomed the entrepreneurs. G.P. Lenin, president, DICCI, Chennai Region, said that efforts were on to create a rural hub involving entrepreneurs.

The entrepreneurs would be identified at rural areas and based on the database, the DICCI would assist entrepreneurs in obtaining loans from banks and offer technical support to them. Dinesh S. Sankar, a representative of the DICCI, explained the process of getting bank loans. The bankers would normally provide loans based on eligibility conditions.

K.S. Prabakar, Lead District Manager, State Bank of India, Thoothukudi, Jerina Bubby, Assistant Director, Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME), Development Institute, Ganesh, president, Thoothukudi District Tiny and Small Scale Industries Association (THUDITSSIA), and others spoke.

Around 300 entrepreneurs participated.
title: Awareness programme for SC/ST entrepreneurs
